definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: The cat was sitting on an upturned crate.
sentences.chinese: 貓兒蹲坐在倒放的板條箱上。

sentences.english: Water jar seeper stops to prevent in the shop, upend is worn.
sentences.chinese: 商店裏爲了防止水缸積水，都是倒放着的。

sentences.english: This filter makes a clip play in reverse.
sentences.chinese: 此濾鏡用於倒放一段視頻。

sentences.english: She turned the cup upside down.
The cat was sitting on an upturned crate .
sentences.chinese: 貓兒蹲坐在倒放的板條箱上。

sentences.english: Place the garlic on the saucer, invert the pot, and place it over your garlic.
sentences.chinese: 把大蒜放在茶托上，然後將赤土罐罐口對準大蒜倒放。

sentences.english: Lips: Heavy, thick, and long, the upper lips join beneath the nostrils to form an inverted "V".
sentences.chinese: 上嘴脣結合鼻孔的下部形成一個倒放的“V”。

sentences.english: Q. Soda bottle tops: on or off before recycling?
sentences.chinese: 汽水瓶循環利用之前是應該正放還是倒放？

definition: vertical/to erect/to set upright/vertical stroke in Chinese characters/young servant (old)
